intro: Peucedanum oligophyllum subsp. aequiradium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parsley. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its distinctive, often pungent aroma. Its stems and leaves are typically covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
